title: Sri Lanka will decide on feasibility of project only
byline: Sri Lanka will decide on the acceptance of over US $ 62 million grant for the development of Kankesanthurai Port (KKS), depending on the business feasibility of the project only, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Kodituwakku said yesterday.

title: Gary Anandasangaree appointed Canadian Public Safety Minister
byline: Tamil Canadian MP Gary Anandasangaree has been appointed today as the Minister of Public Safety in Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s new Cabinet.

title: Private security officers arrested over theft at Swiss Ambassador’s residence
byline: The Kollupitiya Police have arrested three individuals, including the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of a private security firm and another security officer, in connection with a theft at the official residence of the Swiss Ambassador in Colombo, where gold jewellery, including a diamond-studded ring and luxury wristwatches worth approximately Rs. 4.5 million were stolen from a safe.

title: Chickenpox vaccines out of stock amid rise in cases
byline: Amid a slight increase in chickenpox cases, the varicella vaccine that helps prevent the disease is currently out of stock at hospitals, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Trump pledges to lift Syria sanctions as he seals $142bn arms deal on Saudi visit
byline: President Donald Trump has said the US has ’’no stronger partner’’ than Saudi Arabia during his first major foreign trip - a whirlwind visit of Gulf countries mainly focused on shoring up investment.

title: Writ petition against Dr. Archchuna to be heard on June 26
byline: The writ petition filed seeking an order declaring that Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna is disqualified to be a Member of Parliament was today fixed for support on June 26 by the Court of Appeal.

title: Uruguay’s José Mujica, world’s ’poorest president’, dies
byline: Former Uruguayan President José Mujica, known as ’’Pepe’’, has died at the age of 89.

title: High blood pressure responsible for 70% of deaths in Sri Lanka
byline: High blood pressure is a leading cause of death in Sri Lanka accounting for approximately 70% of all fatalities nationwide, the Non-Communicable Disease (NCD) Unit of the Ministry of Health revealed.

title: Police launch night-time inspections to curb bus accidents
byline: In response to the recent surge in road accidents involving buses, police have stepped up night-time inspections of long-distance passenger buses in an effort to reduce such incidents.

title: Trump confirms Qatar gifted plane will serve as temporary Air Force One
byline: President Donald Trump confirmed that a luxury jet offered by the government of Qatar will serve as a temporary Air Force One, a move that has raised ethical and security concerns in Washington.

title: Several Dolphins wash ashore in Kalutara
byline: At least six dolphins were found washed ashore on Kalutara South beach, according to wildlife officials.

title: ICC World Test Championship Final 2025 squads
byline: South Africa and Australia put forward their 15-player squads for World Test Championship Final beginning on June 11 at Lord’s.

title: PHIs urge proper waste disposal after Dansals
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Association has urged organizers of recent dansals to properly dispose of the waste generated during these events.

title: SriLankan eyes five new aircraft including two narrow-bodies by 2026
byline: Sri Lanka’s loss-making national carrier, SriLankan Airlines, plans to add five new aircraft including two narrow-body planes to its fleet by March 2026, according to a top company official.

title: Nearly 20,000 Dengue cases reported this year
byline: The National Dengue Control Center (NDCC) has reported a total of 19,901 dengue cases across the country so far this year.

title: Microsoft to lay off 6,000 workers globally in cost-cutting move
byline: Microsoft on Tuesday said it was slashing unnecessary layers of management and seizing the benefits of new technology as reports said the tech behemoth was laying off thousands of workers.

title: Deadline announced for naming key Local Council officials
byline: Elections Commission Chairman R.M.A.L. Rathnayake has announced that political parties and independent groups have one week to provide the names of individuals selected for key positions in the local councils.

title: Over 20 trains cancelled due to absence of engine drivers, guards
byline: More than 20 train journeys have been cancelled by this afternoon due to the absence of engine drivers and guards,the  Railways Department said.

title: Foreign Minister summons Canadian High Commissioner over genocide allegations
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath today (14) summoned the Canadian High Commissioner in Colombo to reiterate the Government of Sri Lanka’s strong objections regarding the unfounded genocide allegations and the approval of constructing a monument, which complicates and undermines the government’s efforts toward reconciliation and national unity.

title: Harak Kata makes serious allegation against Tiran Alles, Deshabandu
byline: Notorious underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias Harak Kata, has alleged that he is being detained in Tangalle as a result of his refusal to pay a Rs. 300 million bribe allegedly demanded by former Public Security Minister Tiran Alles and suspended Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Justice BR Gavai takes oath as 52nd Chief Justice of India; first Buddhist CJ in India
byline:
President Droupadi Murmu on Wednesday (14) administered the oath of office to Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai as the 52nd Chief Justice of India (CJI). He took the oath of affirmation in Hindi.
He is the first practising Buddhist to be Chief Justice of India.

title: “Go back to Colombo”, Mayor of Brampton chants racist slurs on anti Genocide supporters
byline: Brampton Mayor Patrick has defended the creation of a Tamil genocide memorial, telling those who deny that ethnic cleansing took place in Sri Lanka will be ignored.

title: Mahindananda files anticipatory bail application over controversial fertilizer deal
byline: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage has filed an anticipatory bail application, citing the likelihood of imminent arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over the importation of a substandard stock of organic fertilizer from a private Chinese company. Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali has ordered that the application be taken up for consideration on the 19th.

title: Namal welcomes Govt’s move in summoning Canadian High Commissioner over false genocide allegations
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa today welcomed the government’s move in summoning the Canadian High Commissioner to the Foreign Ministry to express its objection over Canada’s false genocide allegations during Sri Lanka’s war against the LTTE and the Canadian government’s move in unveiling a Tamil Genocide monument.

title: Two-day vehicle tuning dansala for Vesak
byline: A two-day vehicle tuning dansala will be held tomorrow (15) and the day after (16) in front of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) head office in Narahenpita, to mark Vesak Poya day. The event was inaugurated by DMT Commissioner General Kamal Amarasinghe.

title: 17 passengers including children sustain injuries when van veers off road in Ramboda
byline: At least 17 persons including seven children sustained injuries and were hospitalised when the van they were travelling in had veered off the road and plunged into a roadside precipice in Ramboda this afternoon, the police said.

title: 'Teacher Amma' surrenders before court, gets bail
byline: Absconding primary tutor Hayeshika Fernando also known as ‘Teacher Amma’ surrendered before the Negombo Court this afternoon through her attorney and was granted bail.

title: CSE rallies past 16,100 as global economic tensions ease, boosting investor sentiment
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the session with strong upward momentum, surpassing the 16,100 mark amid renewed investor confidence. This surge was driven by easing global economic tensions, particularly between the United States and China, which provided a supportive backdrop for equity markets worldwide.

title: Kotmale bus accident: Compensation to be paid by relevant Divisional Secretariats
byline: Compensation of Rs. 1 million will be provided for each individual who lost their lives in the accident in the Garandiella area, Kotmale at the relevant Divisional Secretariats, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Three drown in sea off Wellamakare in Wennappuwa
byline: Three youths drowned while a group of six young men who were enjoying a bath in the sea off Wellamakare in Wennappuwa got into difficulties when they were carried away by the waves.

title: Court orders medical examination for 'Harak Kata'
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Sujeewa Nissanka today ordered that an official report on the health condition of notorious criminal gang leader and alleged drug trafficker Nandun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, also known as ’’Harak Kata,’’ be submitted to the court following a medical examination conducted by the regional Judicial Medical Officer (JMO).

title: SLPP, SLFP and several parties meet RW and agree to form joint local administrations
byline: Several opposition party leaders, including those from the SLPP and SLFP, met with former President Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday to discuss forming joint administrations in local government bodies and they have agreed in principle to collaborate moving forward.

title: Fuel bowser overturns in Talawakele, causing major traffic disruption
byline: A fuel bowser transporting 33,600 litres of diesel and petrol overturned on the Nuwara Eliya-Kirimetiya road in Talawakele this afternoon, causing a major traffic blockade and fuel leakage.

title: 38 arrested for illegal fishing
byline: A total of 38 individuals involved in various illegal fishing activities were apprehended following search operations conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy, with the assistance of Fisheries Inspectors, from April 21 to 28.

title: 14 year old child lured to drink illicit liquor
byline: Residents of Barwatta yesterday staged a protest against using a 14 year child to pluck coconuts and offering him a drink of illicit liquor as his wage and compelling the police to take action against the illicit breweries and liquor dens in the area.

title: Media Minister invites media fraternity to make National Media Policy
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa today invited members of the local media fraternity and trade unions to actively participate in creating a much anticipated National Media Policy, hence not postpone it for another couple of years.
